alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 7:19AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an areas of showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall moving into Downtown Charleston. A quick 1 inch of rain could occur through 815 AM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas in parts of the Downtown area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Charleston.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
